alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 13 at 6:20PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area. This includes the city of Yakutat. * WHEN...Until Midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Persons living along streams should stay alert and be prepared to take action if a warning or advisory is issued, or flooding is observed.

area.areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area
